aims.text: ###FROM EXAMPLE###The Project Portal is intended to be a platform for state agencies to communicate about their projects. These might be proposed projects looking for partners or funding, ongoing-projects, or completed projects.

faq.title: ###FROM EXAMPLE###Can we set up our own Project Portal?
faq.text: ###FROM EXAMPLE###Absolutely. Get in touch with The Policy Lab to find out how, [via the contact page!](/contact)

faq.title: ###FROM EXAMPLE###Are there project portals which are already live?
faq.text: ###FROM EXAMPLE###Yes. North Carolina has a project portal here: [https://projectportal.nc.gov](https://projectportal.nc.gov).

contact.title: ###FROM EXAMPLE###How do I connect with The Policy Lab to find out more about setting up a Project Portal for my agency?
contact.lede: ###FROM EXAMPLE###If you have questions or feedback about the Project Portal, please use the form below. Your submission will go to OSP and The Policy Lab at Brown University, which is collaborating with agencies on Project Portals.

open.title: ###FROM EXAMPLE###Open partnership opportunities
open.lede: ###FROM EXAMPLE###State agencies are increasingly interested in collaborating with external partners to answer questions that inform decision making and improve policy and programmatic functions. Learn more below about some open opportunities. Have a question about partnerships? Visit our [FAQ](/about) page.

completed.title: ###FROM EXAMPLE###Completed projects
completed.lede: ###FROM EXAMPLE###State agencies collaborate with external partners to answer important research, policy, and programmatic questions. Learn more below about some completed projects. Have a question about partnerships? Visit our [FAQ](/about) page.

ongoing.title: ###FROM EXAMPLE###In-progress projects
ongoing.lede: ###FROM EXAMPLE###State agencies collaborate with external partners to answer important research, policy, and programmatic questions. Learn more about in-progress projects here. Have a question about partnerships? Visit our [FAQ](/about) page.

bottom_banner.text: ###FROM EXAMPLE###This project portal example content was developed by the The Policy Lab and the Center for Computation and Visualization at Brown University. If you have ideas for how to improve it, please [let us know!](/contact)
